news_header: Friedrich Merz proposes permanent border controls and denying asylum seekers entry at German borders, raising concerns across Europe.
news_original_title: How the German election may shape migration in the entire EU
news_text: Friedrich Merz, CDU's chancellor candidate, advocates for permanent Schengen border controls and denying entry to asylum seekers already in the EU. His proposals, supported by far-right parties, could impact European asylum policies and relations with neighboring countries. Critics warn this could lead to legal and humanitarian issues, while EU member states are increasingly adopting tougher stances on asylum.
